intro: Eriosema sacleuxii, commonly known as the velvetleaf eriosema, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in grasslands and rocky areas. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It has a taproot system and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Eriosema sacleuxii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
